Reviews.Title: “Much more than meets the eye”
Reviews.Author: KLMChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this hotel. While the parking could be a tad tight, it was still convenient, and very decently priced (this is LA, afterall), services, facilities were of high quality for this moderately priced hotel. I found the included extended continental breakfast perfectly acceptable. They even allowed me early breakfast access as I had to leave for a very early flight. I think I must have been upgraded, because the room was quite large, and very nicely decorated, with very comfortable "lounge" chair. I found the location on the fringe of "south" Beverly Hills near Pico Blvd. to be excellent, and convenient for all my needs. Staff was invariably helpful. This is truly a great value for Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “They have thought of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Eryn L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fabulous time at the Best Western Carlyle Inn. We have been around the USA on tour and our last stop was LA. Best Western Carlyle Inn was the only hotel we stayed at to have free wi-fi and complementary buffet breakfast which was served in a lovely garden restaurant and was a great start to the morning. The rooms are meticulously clean and well designed, with complimentary toiletries, water and coffee. Everything is so well presented (even the towels!). There is even a computer to access in the lobby with more coffee and cookies available. My husband and I enjoyed utilising the jacuzi and gym. The front desk staff were so kind and helpful (A first in the US for us) particulaly Juan Carlos who was amazing! Location is great. Beverly Hills is much safer. A short cab ride (everything is a cab ride in LA) to great stores, restaurants etc. Will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “None”
Reviews.Author: textiletyke
Reviews.Content: Liked the parking for I did have a handicapped permit and didn't have to park in the gate underground garage my entire four day stay, which was within walking distance of family. Breakfeast nothing fancy but it did the trick would have liked a microwave only qualms for me is driving back from days in the valley and Orange County traffic is murder in L.A. Still with family here, I'd come back though I may stay closer to family next time for they are 30minute drive and more in traffic

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent breakfast for this price range”
Reviews.Author: Jarimalla
Reviews.Content: When travelling with a car (how else can you see LA?) these kind of hotels are the best choice. Not too big, easy to find, near the main attractions and still in a very nice neighborhood. Basic services like groceries and restaurants are well available within walking distance. The area is just outside the Beverly Hills city limit and rather upscale. Distance to Universal and Warner studios about 30 mins and Hollywood and Sunset Boulevards and Rodeo Drive are just few minutes away. Closest option for one stop shopping with excellent parking facilities is the Beverly Center. By american standards for this price range, the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great”
Reviews.Author: Clete
Reviews.Content: When looking at the reviews, I was beginning to think I had stayed at a different hotel from the other reviewers. My wife and I were staying in the area due to some meetings and did not want to commute. We stopped by at about 2:00PM and did a quick check-in. During check-in I asked for a place to eat and the desk clerk gave me directions to where she said “were lots of restaurants”. I went up to the room and when I opened the door, I was almost knocked over by the smell. It smelled like a combination of mold and wet carpet. I didn’t have time to change rooms at that point and opened the window to air the room out. I then set off to find the restaurants and found the directions lacking badly (she had said turn left on the street, but pointed right). One direction ended up in a residential area on a dead end and we drove for about 2 miles in the other direction only to find two restaurants, neither which appealed to us. We returned to the room at about 6:30 only to find the smell still there (while not as bad, I still had to take an antihistamine) and that there were no other rooms. There was a new desk clerk on and when we asked her about a possible restaurant within walking distance (we were afraid to move the car as we had a very early appointment and could not get blocked in), she sent us to Subway! When we started walking down the street, we discovered a wonderful Thai restaurant almost directly across from the hotel. After a great dinner, we returned to the room. During our stay, I made the following observations: Staff: Clueless and two seamed more intent on talking with a friend than waiting on guests. Bed: OK, but sheets were rough and full of “pills” Room: Small, reminded me of a European hotel Noise: There is a great amount of noise from people walking by outside. Also if anyone within a couple of rooms used the shower or toilet, it sounded as if they were in your room. This of course got better after about midnight. Shower: Great shower head, nice soaps, soft towels Parking: Terrible, if you don’t get there early it is very easy to get your car blocked in by other vehicles. Food: did not get a chance to try due to early check-out I doubt we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: bvassimon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 3 nights. It was a quite spacious 2 queen beds room. We arrived late and still were well received. The decoration of the room was nice and it was clean. The bathroom was also good and clean. The breakfast was nice and so was the breakfast area. There is a parking garage, very important in LA, a pool and a gym. There is also included wifi which worked great. The location is good, in beverly hills, and there are places to eat nearby. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: janet w
Reviews.Content: great value, great service, very helpful staff, especially Juan-Carlos at front desk. perfect for our stay as a family in LA, connecting rooms and confortable beds. Even cheaper price when we booked over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced and Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: essie022
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle Inn is reasonably priced, clean, and the breakfast was tasty! Our room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. They also have a lovely deck with plush chairs for sunbathing or relaxing. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: koponx
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with full of surprise, At first, we were a bit skeptical because the building didn't look much from the outside and surrounded by small shops and houses, with small lobby and reception area. Once we got to the room, it was spacious, clean and modern looking. We felt comfortable right away. The staffs was helpful and nice and the breakfast was simple but nice. The location was also great, with many nice restaurants and shopping areas like the Groves or Farmers' Market within 10 minutes drive from the hotel. It is really a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joan L
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable, clean and more spacious than what we expected. The people at the front desk were attentive to every request we had and made our stay extra pleasant! We discovered an Asian fusion eatery (Komodo)around the corner from the hotel and had one of the most fantastic food in the 2 weeks we were in California. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay close to Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Beverly Hills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mjnvakantiecoach
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not look much from outside but inside it gives the feeling to be in a building built by Gaudi! Rooms are clean, the buffet is included in the price, free parking and wi-fi, a small whirlpool and a gym: in other words everything you need to have a nice stay in Los Angeles. The personel was helpful, the area was nice and safe. Just a shame that cutlery and plates at breakfast all were in plastic. That gave a very cheap feeling for such a nice hotel! I however would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Much More Than Meets the Eye!”
Reviews.Author: hbpLongmont_CO
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this hotel doesn't look like much since it's wedged between some small stores and the reception desk is on the garage level. But, once you go up one level, you're in for a real surprise. There's a beautiful open courtyard filled with flowers and shrubs -- this just isn't visible from the street! Everything about our stay here was great -- The hotel staff was extremely helpful and went out of their way to meet our needs. There's a computer for guest use in the lobby as well as fruit and cookies. There was also free wireless internet. The daily breakfast was very good and plentiful with lots of choices in both cold and hot food offerings. The rooms were clean and stocked with nice toiletries and the bed was quite comfortable. The only noise problem I had was the occasional sound of sirens from emergency vehicles. We didn't have a car but were able to get around pretty well with local bus transportation and also one of the commercial tour companies that picks up at the hotel. The location was excellent for our restaurant needs -- many choices just a short walk away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in LA”
Reviews.Author: Zuben
Reviews.Content: Okay, "Best Western" and "boutique" aren't usually sittin' side-by-side, but what a wonderful surprise this hotel was. We stayed two nights in November, 2011. We chose this hotel partly because of the brand, but also its location to friends nearby. I don't think we could have selected anything better unless someone could have personally recommended another known establishment. The price is moderate, and one does have to pay for parking ($14/night), but it was security-gated. Easy access to our room via elevators and nice view of the courtyard. Had the weather been accomodating, we might have taken advantage of the outdoor seating there for breakfast, but the breakfast room was very nice (as was the complimentary continental breakfast). The front desk staff was very professional and addressed my requests promptly. The hotel is about a block from West Pico, so there's easy walking distance to a Starbucks and restaurants there. If you plan to stay in the Century City/Beverly Hills/West Hollywood area, you should add this to your list to consider. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: cookieusretired
Reviews.Content: My son was married and we needed a place for our extended family that was close to the venue and reasonable. That we had and the plus was that it had a great breakfast room to congregate with open space both outside of that area, plus upside with a few lounge chairs and a spa. The breakfast itself was great - eggs, potatoes, cereal, fruit, rolls - the works. The rooms were very nice - not super big, but adequate with a nice bath. Wifi is free and the small lobby area had fresh cookies and fruit every afternoon. Customer service was good. Parking is not free, but there is a garage both street level and down below that is gated. Make sure you park where they say for the bottom garage or your car hood will be damaged for sure - it swints out.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gail M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff, very good breakfast, nice rooms, comfy beds. overall stay was excellent, would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: clark67
Reviews.Content: The layout of this facility is nice with rooms surrounding the pool area and the room used for breakfast also adjoining the pool. We've stayed there to visit family and it's perfect for that and for the neighborhood. Street parking is avail free at meters at night, needing to be "fed" after 8 AM. Near Starbucks, Walgreens and other local shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: The Carlyle is a great hotel - lovely rooms (we had a free upgrade) with excellent amenities (nice products, flat screen tv, coffee maker, safe, fridge) which are large and very clean. The free breakfast is great too (although there was bacon only on one of the four mornings) and served in the bright conservatory room. You do need a car to see anything in LA though, but the parking is only $14 a day. The Thai restaurant opposite (Shri Laa or something similar) is totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here several times and will certainly go back!”
Reviews.Author: bubbe49
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. The rooms are clean, spacious and quiet. The breakfast is great and the outdoor facilities are lovely. So far it is the best all around deal we have found in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Koko99
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit worried to travel to LA because of all the bad neighborhood around. I was undecided to stay between santa monica for the beach and beverly hills to be central to everything we needed to do. I finally choose this hotel because the other one was full and havn't regretted it (don't stay in Santa Monica if you're spending less than 300$/night). Nice interior courtyard, not a lot of room which is nice because it's a quiet hotel. We were upgraded without charge to a business class room upon arrival because the there was no more standard room available for two night in row. Breakfast area is vast and comfy, food is really good. They offer scrambled eggs which is a nice way to start a day. We had a sport car which was very safe in the interior garage (for 14$ a day). Don't let you bother with the exterior appearance of the building, it is really a nice hotel, in between everything you can visit in LA, so you don't have too long to travel to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chilfw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean, free wifi, free breakfast, nice outdoor seating area.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: mfedderson
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here for 1 weekend a month over a period of 9 months. The accommodations were perfect. The staff were extremely friendly and always helpful. Definitely was my "home away from home!"

Reviews.Title: “very satisfactory fr0m all point of view especially the staff service”
Reviews.Author: ami125
Reviews.Content: the room was clean, spotless,everything we needed was immediately supplied . Coffee and home made cookies at the lobby and a nice buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Citytrip”
Reviews.Author: blum_la
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were in LA for a Citytrip. The Carlyle in was a perfect hotel to stay. verry comfort beds, clean rooms, easy nice breakfast and excelent help from the front desk. if we had any questions (about the bus, rental cars, visitingtours) we could ever ask the front desk for help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful location, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Michelelj72
Reviews.Content: My husband had surgery at Cedars Sinai on May 6, 2011 and we needed a hotel close to the hospital. I read the reviews here and decided on the Best Western Plus Carlyle Inn. What a wonderful place! The rooms were very CLEAN and the beds comfortable. We had 2 double beds and my in laws had the adjoining King room. We were all completely satisfied and would stay here again. The breakfast was yummy every morning. My son enjoyed the jacuzzi spa and small exercise room. The outdoor lounge area was perfect and you can see the Hollywood sign off in the distance from the balcony overlooking the street. The staff were all extremely friendly and the secure parking garage under the building was great and you can't beat the $11 per night parking fee. You won't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “location, comfort, good price”
Reviews.Author: josefdauber
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is excellent, not just because is right in front of the kabbalah center which is the purpose of my visits to LA, but its location, you either could walk take a taxi or bus to go out dinner, shopping right in beverly hills best places, the hotel personel from the managers to the maintenence is excelent, their service in whatever you ask for, also the rooms are very nice, the bathrooms, even the breakfast are very good and the lounge outdoor area where the jacuzzi is, is very nice, also the hotel for being so small makes it very exclusive and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & friendly”
Reviews.Author: SueDonimLMR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient for a visit to family living nearby. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice and helpful kitchen staff and the plus of being able to eat on the patio on sunny mornings. The unusual design made it different to more run of the mill hotels and the floral plantings were pleasant. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were adequate and beds were comfortable. On the downside, the WiFi didn't work in our room, although the hotel waived some charges because of this. Our room at the rear tended to be noisy, with garbage bins being emptied in the early hours on several mornings. Also, the housekeeping trolleys were noisy when wheeled on the tiled floors. The layout of the hotel is a bit confusing, with several levels; it would benefit from more signage and also more lighting when leaving the lift on the bedroom floors.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Discovery!”
Reviews.Author: pchfyh
Reviews.Content: Unusually courteous, helpful, solicitous staff from the maids to the Front Desk personnel. Room impeccably clean and well maintained, cozy and with all necessary amenities. A pleasing, surprising discovery! Peter and Frances Handler Santa Fe, New Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Very happy.”
Reviews.Author: LondonUKHappy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in a number of hotels in this area over the last few years and found the Carlyle to be the best by far. It is clean, comfortable and the staff are friendly and efficient. The room, although small was clean and comfortable. As it is in a predominantly Jewish area it was very comforting to find that the staff were aware of the requirements of those observing the Sabbath and were happy to advise us as to what items available for breakfast were Kosher. Very happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, but pricy and noisy”
Reviews.Author: SFMissionTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was sent here because of a mixup at the last minute, so I got a street facing room that was quite noisy. The room was nice enough but the same price as the much nicer place I was supposed to stay. A fairly non descript neighborhood but not hopeless. I'd never schedule a long vacation there, but in a pinch, it has a nice feel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_January
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very comfortable. The room was compact but lovely. The breakfast was really delicious. Although the staff and customer service was adequate, something was left to be desired on that count. The courtyard on the inside is very pretty and calming - a great place to gather a large family group.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cosy - small comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: HDavidMc
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel. Only around 32 rooms, so no crush at the breakfast tables. Rooms are comfotable and renovated. Situation on S Robertson Avenue, a little south of the uber trendy shopping areas north of 3rd St. Secure parking at around $10 / day. Well worth consideration for a location near Beverley Hills

Reviews.Title: “A great value”
Reviews.Author: pianojoe
Reviews.Content: This was not a leisure trip, but a medical one. A long drive from Santa Barbara to Los Angeles. left me very anxious to hit the bed. Beds are over-laden with pillows and matching bed coverings. At my request, the number of pillows was cut back. The hotel provides underground parking behind a locked gate. Caution is required when the gate opens; stay behind the marked red line! Breakfasts are a treat. hey are far more than Continental! Eggs. waffles, cereals, bvagels, muffins. juices, etc. This hotel is a real value, highly recommended despite my few minor complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short stop”
Reviews.Author: NickKaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here travelling up coast - only had one night in LA and this was fine for what we were wanting. Being our first time in LA had heard scare stories about staying in hotels in terribel areas so we chose this due to the fact that it was in Beverly Hills. Location is excellent, Ivy restaurant is just along the road from here. Staff were also very helpful. They sorted out all trips we wanted to make on arrival and kept out bags and let us use car park until up till 6pm, well after checkout. Hotel was quite basic but clean and fine for a bed for the night which is what we were after. Free breakfast rolls in the morning which was good. Would stay here again if ever back in LA

Reviews.Title: “What a great little place”
Reviews.Author: michaelwebster65
Reviews.Content: After a 14hr flight from Melbourne to LA, it was a pleasant surprise to check into such a great hotel. From the outside, it doesn't look really inviting, however, when you go inside you will change your mind. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. the courtyard area was a great little spot to rest and take in some sunshine. Breakfast each morning was provided at the small restaurant room on level 1 and was very good each morning. Its is close (next corner) to Pico Blvd where a 70 cent bus ride will drop you off at Santa Monica Pier. As its on Robertson Blvd, it also close to Rodeo Dve and also the Beverley Centre to do your shopping. Next time I'm in LA, I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: gwenann
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LA on the hottest day they've had since records began (113F before the thermometer broke), but the air conditioning worked a treat. Had requested a room close to our friends, but told when booking in it was not possible and to come back the next morning. Was told next morning we would be moving rooms, but we had booked a sightseeing tour and the hotel staff moved all our luggage even the items we had forgotten to pack!! A PC linked to a printer was located in the lobby which we used to print our boarding tickets for our flight home to the UK. At LA airport we were able to check-in quickly. Free coffee and cookies were always available. The rooms were modern and clean with plenty of thick white fluffy towels. Parking was available at a daily rate of $11. No swimming pool but there is a hot tub and thick matresses on the sun loungers. We used the blue and orange line buses to go to the Farmers Market and the Berverley Shopping Center. We caught the Orange 220 bus from the Beverly Centre and it stopped outside the Hotel. Heavy traffic on Robertson Blvd which we overlooked but was not intrusive and did not keep us awake. Good selectio of hot and cold breakfast - pity about the plastic cuttlery. The only downside - not many restaurants within walking distance, but there is a very good Thai restaurant on the corner of Robertson Blvd and Olympic - around 300 yards.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Carlyle!”
Reviews.Author: cubxxlookin4u
Reviews.Content: This hotel maintains wonderful rooms & grounds that are very nice patio areas. The front dest staff are all very helpful especially Juan Carlos! The rooms are very clean as I have inspected them and the breakfast is very nice, so much more then other hotels! Check it out soon!! I have been staying here on and off since August 2007 and would not stay anywhere else when in West LA/ Beverly Hills area. I have found it is hard to book reservations at times because they tend to sell out. The area is fine, remember parts of lower Beverly Hills are older and across Pico Bl. towards Walgreens is the beautiful area of Beverly Woods, homes in that area go from 1.3 million on up! So don't judge the area until you find out the facts! The apartments may not lok like much but go from 1,700 to 3,500 a month. The area is safe~Stepping outside I usually walk to Walgreens but leave the hotel via a wonderful towncar service! I enjoy this hotel and you will too!! Mark D.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Gazina
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, son in law and myself stayed at the Carlyle Inn just recently and had a very enjoyable time there. Although rooms were small they were still big enough to move around in. The place itself doesn't look much from the outside, but, on the first floor where breakfast is served it is lovely. The breakfast was also very good and filling, fruit, cereal, muffins, danish, toast, waffles, eggs, bacon, hash browns. Too good. The only problem was a guest who continually paraded around in his dressing gown all day, talking to his computer in a loud voice and because the volume was turned up loud, we could hear both parties yabbering to each other . I also heard him from my room. I found the hotel staff very helpful with directions and friendly. There were a couple of eating places, pizza, subway, and a very lovely Chinese restaurant, Fu's palace, plenty of food and delicious. I would have no hesitation staying here again. Thank you Carlyle Inn.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN TREASURE IN BEVERLY HILLS”
Reviews.Author: mrsmarv
Reviews.Content: My son lives in Hollywood so my daughter, her boyfriend and I wanted to go for a visit. I found the Best Western Carlyle through Priceline at a bargain price for hotel/air for a week. I had done a lot of research on Trip Advisor about this hotel and knew it would be a perfect fit for our trip. Even with reviews by others, you still never know. Well . . . trust me, this hotel is amazing. The only issue is parking. You can elect to park your car in their lot for a daily fee of like $11/day but there is on street parking in front of the hotel which we opted to use. The only issue is that you have to move your car by 8:00 a.m. Not a problem - I gladly moved my car to save the money. The hotel lobby is small but the staff is friendly and very accommodating! The open air atrium that is the center of the rooms is beautiful and clean! The complimentary breakfast is amazing! You can grab something on the go - bagels, muffins, fruit - or make your own waffle using the pre-measured batter provided or have scrambled eggs or cereal. The food was plentiful and the hot egg choice changed daily so you didn't get bored. This hotel location is central to all the sites and is such a bargain. Save your money for other things and stay here for a perfect experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MTwallets
Reviews.Content: We found this accommodation through Priceline.com and booked it for an absolute bargain price! We loved the idea of staying in Beverley Hills but werent quite sure of the lodgings itself as the Best Western chain doesnt exactly have the most amazing reputation. Well, we were pleasantly surprised. We got checked in straight away (despite our early arrival), had a lovely, clean and quiet room and more than anything, the staff were exceptional. If they were any more helpful or friendlier, they would have piggy backed us around LA! The location is a bit far from most places, but nothing that car hire, taxis, public transport and a little leg work cant fix!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Carlyle = Best Kept Secret in LA”
Reviews.Author: mamie222
Reviews.Content: So, I must admit, I was less than excited when my company booked my stay at a Best Western, but any preconceived notions I might have held quickly melted away upon check-in at the Carlyle Inn. The front desk person was welcoming and helpful, the reception area was tidy and spotless and my stay got better from there. As I found my room and settled in I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness. The decor looks to have been recently updated -it was modern and comfortable. My colleague and I commented several times about the comfortable beds. The size of the room was somewhat small, but ample. My room was on the first floor facing Robertson - some traffic noise, but this didn't affect my sleeping. The spotless bathroom sports granite countertops and was always stocked with fresh towels (to my chagrin). The maid did replace towels every day, even when they were hung, as instructed, to be reused. The coffee maker was located on a shelf in the bathroom (in an alcove, away from the toilet), which I did find somewhat odd, but, then, I don't drink coffee, so it was not a problem for me. If I did have a complaint, it would be that the sink is in a strange location in relation to the toilet (see photo) - but, really, that is just being picky. The personnel at the hotel were all pleasant. The attendants at the front desk were always for advice and directions. Our room was straightened every day. Our free breakfast was always stocked, warm and fresh. Speaking of breakfast, this was not just cold cereal and pasteries - though they were there, too - BWCI had fresh scrambled eggs, cheese mini omlettes, waffles, toast, fruit, cheese and bacon. Definitely some healthy choices there. All in all I would say this is a great little hotel. Free Wifi. The neighborhood is nice and feels safe, I walked the 1/2 mile down to Wilshire for work every morning and evening. Some fun little boutiques and, many massage/nail salons in the area for a relaxing reflexology appointment, should you need. Couple decent restaurants nearby. Not too far from the action.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel curb appeal doesn't do justice to the upscale amenities found inside the rooms and patio area.”
Reviews.Author: jmart944
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel twice in the last five years because of its proximity to our daughter's apartment. We've been pleasantly surprised both times. Upon entering the lobby you'll notice the unique furnishings and decorations. The large patio and sundeck are surrounded by the 32 rooms, which have recently been upgraded to superior quality. This trip we stayed in a king suite. It was very comfortable; decorated nicely; offered WiFi, a 36" wall mounted LCD TV and an up to date bath. Parking is also available and a daily complimentary hot breakfast is included. The patio has 4 umbrella tables plus alcoves for inimate conversations. The sundeck has lounges for relaxtion. There is also a hot tub and exercise area, which we did not use. Employees are friendly, courteous and helpful. On Wednesday we approached the hotel manager and asked if we could host a college graduation party on Friday afternoon. They accomodated our short notice request by clearing the breakfast room so we could set up food on the counters, provided coffee and cleanup services and had a person standby during the party to assist as required. We had full use of the breakfast room and patio. They even posted notices and a welcome sign for our graduate. All of our guests (including some others who were staying at the hotel) commented favorably on this venue for the party. The hotel location is close to Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, the Ivy and all upscale shopping including a movie clothing resale shop called It's a Wrap across the street. STAY HERE. YOU WON'T REGRET IT.

Reviews.Title: “I would live here if I could. Terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: lroden
Reviews.Content: This place looks like nothing from the street, but inside it's got everything you'd want: First, it's clean, clean, clean! Clearly so much care and love goes into taking care of everything. There is not even a brown leaf on the (real) potted palms. The place is spotless inside and out. Second, it's comfortable: BIG rooms, big cushy beds full of crisp linens and lots of new pillows, big bathroom with long marble counter and all the amenities, big bathtub and shower (clean tiles, clean shower curtains, good hot water pressure.) Third, it's got all the extras you'd want: bathrobe, iron and board, half size refrigerator, coffee machine and supplies, flat screen TV with movies on demand, FREE wireless internet access, convenient parking in the building ($10/day which is not bad for the Beverly area of L.A.), FREE breakfast in roomy dining area open from 7-10am (nice selection too - fresh scrambled eggs, hash browns, yogurts, fresh whole fruit, bagels, cereal, toast...), small workout room but since I was the only one who seemed to use it, it was like a private gym; sundeck with nice chaise lounges and hot tub (also had it all to myself), FREE bottles of water in the room and FREE ice machine and FREE apples at the front desk... Last but not least, the little special touches: there is truly someone at the desk 24 hours and I felt totally safe and looked after as a single female traveler; when my TV had a reception problem they knocked themselves out to fix it and offered that I could watch a movie in another room while they did; when the internet was slow one morning they go their ISP on the line who reallocated bandwidth so I could get more speed. Where else do they do all this with a smile? Final note - while there's no restaurant, not only are you in the midst of hundreds of restaurants, but they offer a delivery service from half a dozen restaurants. You will never go hungry here. Bottom line: I got all this for $129/night on Hotels.com in a great section of Los Angeles close to all of my meetings, freeway, etc. Can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great breakfast... small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RambleOn09
Reviews.Content: After several weeks of searching, I found this hotel for a destination wedding. The property is gorgeous, breakfast delicious and the lobby cookies were a nice treat. We had a little trouble getting our rooms serviced a few days but since the wedding party was busy getting dressed, it was understandable. The size of the rooms was a little bit difficult with 5 bridesmaids and a bride trying to get ready but the adjoining rooms were a HUGE help. Love this place ~ would stay here again anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable & convenient & reasonably priced with a very helpful reception”
Reviews.Author: rdfisrael
Reviews.Content: the room was spacious and very well equipped. the bed was very comfortable. the bathroom was clean and also well done. only one improvement should be considered: the shower head should be replaced. secure parking provided @ $1/day. very reasonable. breakfast was ok. the food was fresh and served in an efficient buffet. the paper plates, cups & plastic cutlery were not inviting. one suggestion: replace the paper goods with proper plates, cups, glasses & cutlery.

Reviews.Title: “Calming and Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Terri M
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel's biggest fault is that you can easily drive right by and miss it! Once we found it, my 16-year-old and I were charmed by its modern decor, cool lay-out and many amenities! What a great place at a great price! Our room was gorgeous, with lush comfy beds, bathrobes, luxury bath items, free internet, room service available, and a stellar view of the Hollywood Hills and the Hollywood sign. We loved the courtyard and the way the rooms surroundied it, and although the hot tub looked inviting, we never had a chance to try it out. : ( This place is a little off the beaten path from many of the hot spots of the area, but I didn't feel unsafe in the neighborhood. Both an Orthodox temple and a Kaballah center were across the street and the streets surrounding were residential, with a major business street just a couple of blocks down. It's a bit of a stretch to say it's in Beverly Hills, but it might be on the VERY outskirts. It is a short drive to many places: Farmer's Market, Hollywood, Beverly Hills hotspots and Melrose Avenue and Robertson Blvd., shopping. After going out and having fun shopping on Rodeo Drive and the Beverly Centre, we returned to find no parking available in the hotel's lot. We inquired at the front desk and THEN we were informed that there was an additional underground lot! OH!!! That's was so much better and so much more roomy! However, the security gate opens UP and OUT and WILL hit your car (if it's at all a large car) once you've pulled up far enough to insert your room key to open said gate, so be careful. We have a nice scrape on the front of ours to remember this great place by! I pride myself on finding great gems like this in expensive areas for a great price, and this one definitely fit the bill! The price was reasonable, the amenities great, and the addition of a very generous breakfast was a cherry on top. I will definitely be making a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “You could drive by and miss the Carlyle Inn”
Reviews.Author: MLB-oz
Reviews.Content: ....but luckily we took a punt and book in the last minute. It turn out to be a great base to visit all the attractions in LA. Daily breakfast included, both hot and cold food was available. There is no on site restaurant but they do have room service and there are plenty of places to eat nearby or options for take out/delivery. There is a small under cover car park right next to the reception area and a $US9 is charged for overnight garage. Staff were pleasant and friendly. Our room has two double beds, each a bit small for both of us to sleep on so we had one each. The room was clean and modern, equipped with a large flat screen TV, Tea and coffee making facility. The air condition was a bit noisy when it kicked in but nothing too drastic and certainly didn't kept us awake at the night. Free use of a PC with internet access in reception and there was plenty of up to date tourist information available. It has a small area for some fitness equipment as well.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel - Quality is in the details”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1101
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms via Priceline a few months ago at a great deal. Called about 1 week prior to trip and requested adjoining rooms with windows away from the noise of Robertson Blvd. Got the usual "We can't garantee it, but we'll try." We got two great adjoining rooms, 304 &305, that overlook the courtyard. Rooms were spotless, included flat screen tv, alarm clock, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron, ironing table, fridge(no freezer inside). Great European boutique hotel with modern decor. You can tell throughout the hotel that attention to detail is important. Each room had a live plant...I know that's not a big deal; but most hotels have plastic plants or none at all. Breakfast buffet included eggs, sausage (sometimes hash browns), OJ, cranberry juice, milk, coffee, cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, yogurt, make-your-own waffle, cheeses...and each was refilled without question, even if you came a little before breakfast closing time. Perks included free daily newspaper, apples at the front desk, cookie plate at the front desk, free internet access and printing via desktop computer in lobby, free WiFi, and front desk staff were helpful in suggesting places to eat and providing us with addresses of destinations to plug into our GPS. When we first arrived at the hotel, I couldn't get the digital thermostat to work automatically, within literally three minutes, someone from the front desk came to our room and got it to work. Customer service was great. Location of hotel was PERFECT, not to far from all of our destinations, nothing was more than 20 minutes away. Venice & Santa Monica beach were approx 15 minutes away, Universal Studios 20 min., Getty Center 20 min. Again location was ideal. Only drawback is there is an $11/day charge for parking in the garage, which is open and more like a carport/pavillion. We also, had to leave our keys with the front desk, in case our car needed to be moved. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel for a business or pleasure stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, we could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: dizzydi
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel for West Hollywood/Beverley Hills through Priceline and we got the Best Western Carlyle Inn. We stayed for 3 nights and were very impressed! We found the staff to be polite and helpful - Lizandro was manning reception quite a lot of the time we were there and he was great. We asked him if there were any bars nearby and he told us about 'The Joint'. We went the next night and it was fantastic! Live music and really friendly people. We felt that the location was great - it depends what you want to see in LA, but really there is no central part. Where we stayed was a good neighbourhood, not far from Hollywood, Beverley Hills, etc. We like walking, so explored a lot of the are by foot, but it's so easy and not that expensive to get taxis. I will say though that we don't like to be too far from the action, and never felt that we were. The room was great - very comfortable bed/pillows, coffee maker, decent shower, flat screen tv. The breakfast was also great (only breakfast, not full restaurant) - there was a mixture of hot and cold items, you could make your own waffles and endless tea/coffee/juice. The parking was $10 per night, but we didn't mind that because the garage seems secure you can go straight from there into reception. Also, we got free wifi, there is a hot tub and a very small gym (treadmill, excercise bike, some weights). We really liked it there, would definitely stay again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Double check your reservation.Big disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: zacharybeau
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night stay for my family of 5 in a Junior Suite on the internet. We arrived to be told we could have the room but it only had 1 bed in it and they could provide only 1 rollaway.When I pointed out that the website had allowed me to book for 3 adults and 2 children in this one room the manager said that sometimes 3 adults slept in the bed and 2 children topped and tailed in the rollaway! My children were too big to do this and neither did my husband and I want to share one bed with our 18 year old! I have since been back on the website and it would have let me book 5 adults into the room....cosy! We had carefully researched the hotels we booked for our holiday (thanks to trip advisor!) and out of 6 this was the only let down.The manager did find us another hotel but we were left with having to pay more than $100 extra per night.Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: susanne01
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel on hotwire....was pleasantly surprised by its charm...helpful staff...computer in lobby...parking at 11dollars per night...lovely room just off outdoor breakfast terrace...hotel had hot tub and sun loungers on terrace.. hotel was 40mins walk to farmers market and 30 min walk to Beverly Mall and 35 min walk to rodeo drive... A great base but you do need a car..... Breakfast is served on the first floor restaurant with the option of eating indoors or outdoors, and included waffles, eggs, coffee, tea, breads, bagels, cereals..... Internet access was free also....

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Switz_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Best Western Carlyle Inn in April 2009. The entrance of the hotel may look slightly dodgy, but in fact this hotel is really nice! Upon arrival, we were directly upgraded to a superior room. The windows did not give on the noisy street, but in a cute little courtyard of the hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast was included, it was nothing special but it was nice to be able to have a coffee in the courtyard in the morning. The location is really good, since it is only a few minutes drive to all the main attractions of LA, such as Hollywood Boulevard, Rodeo Drive, etc. In short, this hotel is affordable, clean and in a great location, what more could you want? I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately stay there again. Beautiful courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: Smoky-Mountain-Mom
Reviews.Content: Only 10 minutes from Cedar-Sinai Hospital where we needed to visit. We were pleasantly surprised by this little hotel. It was clean and had a beautiful courtyard with lots of flowers and plants. The staff were very pleasant and helpful in finding good restaurants. Loved the courtyard; could lounge or eat breakfast there. The parking rate of $10 per day was reasonable compared to other hotels nearby. Worth it to have a good location. Internet signal was weak in our room. Rooms were a little small, but was space was adequate for our needs. Air conditioner blew directly on our bed, but with the covers it wasn't much of an issue. Breakfast was adequate. Breakfast staff was friendly and always willing to prepare more food even when they were about to close. Traffic noise wasn't an issue for us either. Could hear cars go by when we were in the courtyard, but I believe that is to be expected when you are downtown. Overall, we really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeatherUK
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 4 nights via Priceline. Parking was $10 per day plus tax. Parking spaces were very limited and sometimes you wouldn't find an available parking spot. They also wanted you to leave your keys so that they could move your car if needed as cars could easily end up getting blocked in! The room was nice and clean and larger than expected. The only problem with the room was that the toilet didn't seem to work properly as it kept making a filling noise unless you shook the handle. The breakfast was lovely. There was a wide choice of food to choose from. Internet access was free, but the wireless internet wasn't working during my stay which was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cubxxlookin4u
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times since September 2007. When checking in the service has always been above the rest and I travel a lot! The staff goes all out and a few times I asked for a certain room and they were happy to make sure it was ready at check in, within a few minutes. Once I arrived and did not like the location of a room and I was moved within minutes. I usually have a room with a sitting area on the same floor where the breakfast room is located. The staff never tells anyone who might spot my friends in the acting business nor anyone who is well known, they ensure my privacy which means a lot! I have entertained at this hotel and we have never been bothered by guests nor staff. I must admit the rooms I have stayed in look much better then their photos. I always need extra items and the front desk manager makes sure the room is well stocked from towels too extra soaps, etc. I usually have a driver and when he arrives the front desk calls me to let me know he has arrived. In the past I have stayed at this hotel to attend parties for The Golden Globes and Grammy Awards since this hotel is located close to any place in Beverly Hills within a 10 min. drive. It is a trendy looking hotel although I have read it seems old world I must wonder if any of these guests have ever seen the real world of Beverly Hills or Brentwood. Their is nothing old world about it, take my word it is a trendy hotel and low key. No need too worry about the area I have walked to Starbucks and Walgreens, without hesitation, noone will bother you. It is a quick 5 - 10 min. drive to The Ivy, The Abbey, La Scala, Beverly Center and about 15 min. drive to the Westside Pavillion Mall on West Pico, all of my favorite places and too visit close friends. The breakfast buffet is very good and I have been there 15 mins. before they close, nothing has been removed and their is always plenty of everything and if not someone from the kitchen will bring it out. It's not a problem at all. I am not a breakfast person but in all my visits decide to eat at this hotel! I remember being there with my mom during the December Holidays and attending close friends Holiday party. We received so many gifts I had the driiver drop them off in our room and come back to pick us up. One shopping bag contained several boxes of candy from Europe. It was left by the waste container in the room with paper wrappings on top. We went out the next morning to Beverly Center and returned to find the bag missing. I will be honest the other shopping bags containing Nordstrom,Gucci boxes was not touched. I called the manager and reported the bag of boxed candy missing, which housekeeping thought was garbage (We figured out) and he had a gift card waiting for us upon check out. It was simple and hassle free. I had only expected a simple "We are sorry", but he went all out. I have left expensive jewelry in the bathroom and is has gone untouched, always, when I am in a hurry or put something else on and the driver is waiting. I think this says it all about how wobderful this hotel has treated me. In the past I usually stay 4 nights and get the lower rate which works out fine. My longest stay was 8 nights over the Holiday season in December and since I am looking for a home in Brentwood/ Beverly Hills will use this hotel in the future for business as well. To everyone be sure to enjoy your stay and enjoy the real Beverly Hills not just the tourist spots!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, location”
Reviews.Author: MsIntl
Reviews.Content: A couple of my girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel for a concert in town on Halloween weekend. It's a small boutique style hotel that we felt was very reasonably priced at about 150 before tax a night. I must say that I did read reviews before booking and was very afraid of not having a reservation, so I called about 3 times to confirm that everything was ok, and it was. It could be that we booked it directly with the hotel? Anyhow, the rates we found booking directly from the company were pretty much the same as hotels.com and other sites...we used AAA so it saved a few dollars. From the moment we walked in, until the moment we walked out, the front staff was really kind and courteous. There aren't a lot of staff (that we could see), but everything seemed very smoothly run, from the breakfast room to the room cleaning. As someone mentioned, it was comfortable and quiet. The hotel is located on Robertson, which is a pretty noisey street...I recommend requesting a room that has a window facing within the hotel. The location was a great, very short driving distance to places like The Grove, Santa Monica and Venice Beach, and Bev hills. We didn't walk anywhere around the hotel (didn't see much w/i walking distance), but there were some food places and a startbucks within a block. Parking in the hotel is not worth it, as people have complained about. But why pay $11 a day when street parking is *free* overnight? I believe it started from 6 pm until 8 am..plus on the side street by the hotel it was an additional 2 hours (so 10 am..or ahem, us girls slept in until 2 on one day and were ok)...so that's a great way to save a few bucks. The room we had was clean, and the beds were comfortable, twin size. The bathroom was ok..but it was the first time I had used a shower where the base of the shower connected to the bathroom floor....as in no tub. It's not like the shower water went anywhere else in the bathroom, so it was fine. One downfall was that the air conditioner would turn off after a certain somewhat short period of time. We would go to bed with the perfect temperature, then wake up sweating because it was off. I'm not sure if there was a timer on it, or if it was just not working properly? We didn't get a chance to find out. If you notice it giving you the same problem after one night, then check with the front desk about having it fixed. Breakfast at the hotel was great. We made sure to book a hotel with a full breakfast as to save time and eat well...I'm a breakfast fanatic. so it was a really good value to me to save the time and money. One day we made it 5 minutes before breakfast closed and the kitchen lady was sooo kind enough to make us 3 waffle batters without us asking. There were some lounge chairs and a mini courtyard in the hotel, so it was nice to eat breakfast outside while it was a little warm. Internet and printing was free, which is rare for so many hotels these days. Overall...I thought the value was great for this hotel. Wonderful staff, free parking outside, decent driving distance to attractions, and breakfast to start your day. Didn't seem great for walking around...but good driving distance to places in West LA/Bev Hills.

Reviews.Title: “booked on Priceline then they played stupid upon arrival??”
Reviews.Author: pernoski
Reviews.Content: Pictures are deceiving! Booked weeks in advance on Priceline and immediately called hotel to confirm.Arrived on scheduled date and they said they didnt have my reservation.I went back to my car to get my receipt from Priceline and after returning they suddenly had it on their computer but didnt have the 2 beds I booked but could UPGRADE me for $20 a night PLUS $11 a night to park on their lot?? Not near enough parking and most spots are tandem spots so theres a good chance you will be blocked in and you are asked to leave your keys at the desk at night incase they have to move your car for someone to get out?? NO VALET AND NO BELLHOP?? The room was nice and the breakfast was great! just plan on being nickel and dimed to death if you book online!!

Reviews.Title: “They lost our reservation”
Reviews.Author: dru276
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation over the hotel's website. We received a confirmation via e-mail, with a confirmation number. We received an e-mail prior to arriving, saying that 'they' were looking forward to our visit. When we arrived (4:00 p.m. on the scheduled day), we were told that they had no record of our reservation, could not locate the reservation number, and had no rooms available. The receptionist did offer us one night free in a sister property (in Santa Monica, not at all near the area of the city where we had wanted to stay). We checked on-line and the reviews were extremely poor. We declined the offer, and made our own arrangements for another hotel elsewhere in the city. The receptionist then offered us three Best Western 'gift cards', each for $50 off a stay at a Best Western. Upon examining the cards, however, they each expired in 1/08. (This was March 2008.) Two of the cards, the receptionist (or someone) had used a black marker to cross out the expiration date. I can really see using one of these cards at some Best Western, and explaining that I was not the person who crossed out the expiration date; that the cards should actually still be accepted! I told the receptionist that I wanted a statement, on the Inn's letterhead, indicating that we had arrived on schedule but there was no reserved room for us, and that we would not later be charged for not showing up at the Inn as per our reservation. The receptionist at first refused, saying that he could not do this. He said that of course we would not be charged. I noted that I had no reason, based on my current experience, to believe him. He offered to call his general manager. I said that was fine; that he could explain to the manager that there were two women there who would not leave without this letter. He then apparently decided that he could provide this letter without calling the general manager. However, the first letter was not on letterhead. The next two times my name was spelled wrong (despite clearly printing my name in two-inch-high letters after the first time). I finally was given the requested letter. While we were trying to make reservations elsewhere, a man came in to check in; from what I overheard, he had booked a room with two double beds. He was being given a room with one king. He was traveling with a friend, not a bed companion. When the man questioned this arrangement, he was told that they could provide a "roll-away" (i.e., a cot). He eventually agreed, but asked if they could transfer him to the requested double room the next night. Good luck to him. I can't tell you anything about the rooms, the ambiance, etc. The lobby looked clean. Oh, and after I arrived home, there was another e-mail from the Carlyle Inn, saying that they appreciate our business and hoped that we enjoyed our stay. If you want to try staying here, good luck. I would recommend that you call in person to double-check any reservations that you make.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, chic little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rocnrlr
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel is tucked away on the very "trafficky" Robertson Blvd., just south of the heart of Beverly Hills (but probably not walking distance) and about a 15 minute drive from Santa Monica, Marina del Rey, or Downtown L.A. It's very quaint, with styles reminiscent of L.A. in th "good old days" (i.e. striped chaise lounges and chair pads on wrought-iron frames). The hotel has a small parking garage (subterranean), with a $11 per day charge (but it was kindly not billed to my hotel tab!) The three floors of room are on open-air walkways, and there is a wonderful little open-air sitting area facing Robertson (I assume for smoking), a beautiful little sun deck above the restaurant's sky lights, and a private, romantic Jacuzzi, off the beaten track, yet in an enclosed, outdoor little cubby up a few steps from the sun deck--quite inviting. The buffet breakfast, starting at 7 a.m. is excellent (arrive at 7:15 if you want eggs or waffles), with eggs, bacon, waffles, omelettes, bagels, hot & cold cereals, juices, etc. The thing I liked best about this hotel was the high level of cleanliness throughout. The only negative comments I have are the heater wasn't working in our second room (and nights were at 43 degrees!) (they did send a crew to fix it, which took over an hour), loud fan (mandatory if light's on) in the bathroom of my first room (but not the second), the slamming nature of doors, and the hotel staff's level of helpfulness was average (a few staff had thick accents that were difficult to comprehend and one staff member couldn't help me over the phone with a question I had about whether my reservation had been paid in full by my employer). Oh, and although I had a non-smoking room, the extra blanket reeked of cigarette smoke, so the housekeeping staff replaced it for me. Overall, I recommend this hotel for its charm, breakfast, location, and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: Tecolate
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special but I would have expected more for the price. It is located in the southern part of Beverly Hills in an area with small businesses on the major streets, and nice neighborhoods on the back streets. We stayed in room 206 which was a junior suite. The room was clean, comfortable and well maintained, with very minor exceptions. A friend stayed in room 405, which was relatively small. The only downside to the room was that the heat/ac fan was a little noisy. But the fan was off most of the time. All rooms open to the courtyard, and traffic noise tends to echo from the rather busy street. However, at night our room was quiet, except for an occasional fire truck. In good weather the courtyard would be a pleasant place to pass some time. The restaurant is only open for breakfast, and the breakfast is comparable to a Hampton Inn. The restaurant staff is excellent. There is free wireless internet, but you get nicked $10/day for parking. The chocolate chip cookies in the lobby are history. Since the hotel is small, the small front desk staff can get overwhelmed with check ins, answering the phone, handling car keys, etc. However, it is a problem of having a small staff, and not the staff members themselves, who are very accommodating. The hotel is not within walking distance of any major attractions, but it is convenient to West LA, Beverly Hills, etc. Several restaurants are withing walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: aztecsince79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a Saturday night there. Ups: Nice big room, comfortable bed. Decent location if you're doing anything in West LA, Beverly Hills, Century City, Culver City and have to watch your budget. Very good chocolate chip cookies in the lobby. Breakfast was adequate, no more so, but not a complete waste of time like at some hotels. Downs: The elevator and the showers. I was part of a group that was in about 10 rooms, and nobody I talked to used the elevator more than once. Kind of like that Tower of Terror ride at California Adventure, if you know what I mean. The shower plumbing was very difficult to figure out and not terribly effective. Outside traffic noise was present but nothing you wouldn't expect. No pool, but it did have a jacuzzi. Make sure you pay attention to the address because it's not easy to see on the street.

Reviews.Title: “nice place for your budget in busy LA”
Reviews.Author: pimmy80
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights in best western Inn hotel LA I loved the service and the price for the budget in this expensive town . The breakfast was ok but I prefer the food from my country more . The maid tried to clean your room everyday in the morning time .The decoration is modern but it would be nicer if having more trees

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing oasis in busy cily”
Reviews.Author: my2dogz
Reviews.Content: In all the hustle and bustle of LA, coming back to the Carlyle Inn was like coming home. There was usually a plate of cookies waiting in the lobby. Upstairs, the rooftop patio with potted pants and hot tub felt like a backyard oasis. In the mornings, breakfast had a wonderful, healthy variety of things to eat: not a lavish buffit with a lot of wasted food, but not your typical, skimpy "continental breakfast" either. I usually made a sandwich of rye toast, egg and tomato, but there were many offerings, including fruit, yogurt, sausage, and bagels. Selections varied somewhat from day to day. My room was comfortable, but not very large.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Humbridge
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Carlyle Inn. I really liked this hotel. It is small, friendly and decorated in a faintly art deco style. The room was clean, recently renovated and had everything I needed. The breakfast was a cut above the normal Best Western continental. The staff were particularly friendly. Parking is quite limited, though there is additional underground parking. However, if you are a large truck, SUV or motor home, then you will have parking trouble. The hotel is conveniently located for the major LA attractions including Beverley Hills, Hollywood and Burbank. The hotel has a more intimate feel than larger hotels and I would wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough.”
Reviews.Author: SactoJD
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in a junior suite. Hotel was nice looking and clean. Rooms were well maintained. Above average breakfast bar, with waffle iron and a different hot entree each morning of our stay. Hotel has exterior corridors so it got a little noisy at night sometimes. Staff was friendly. Parking is cramped and tricky. No pool, but a nice patio area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Eclipse827
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience ever. Very slow check-in. Clerk took eight (count 'em, 8) phone calls during the process, never apologized for the delay nor put one of those calls on hold to finish up with me, the guest standing before him. The property is tired and the photos on the web site are misleading. Yes, there's a certain 50s charm to the place...but I feel there's better value at somewhere like the Hyatt in Hollywood where rooms can be had for $90 nightly via Hotwire or Priceline. Currently, a group of construction workers have taken a block of rooms and have run of the breakfast room in the mornings. That should give you an idea of the way this place is run.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome location”
Reviews.Author: chrisct
Reviews.Content: Just completed 3 day sightseeing in LA post Mexican cruise. The hotel was just great. Very clean, including room and breakfast site. Breakfast was delcious, room very comfy and cozy. Lovely courtyard to sit in the sun while eating or just to relax mid-afternoon. Best of all , very close to access to all major attractions we were interested in. Only disadvantage, no nearby restaurants for evening dining.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melissa8781
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Carlyle. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. We lost our tickets to a game show and the front desk allowed us to print them again on their computer. Breakfast was really good. We weren't in the room all that much, but it was very small but clean. The bed was comfy and internet access had no problems. The bathroom is a nice size. It has lots of pretty gardens and the dining tables outside are nice to sit and eat breakfast in the morning. I didn't hear any noise from neighbors/garbage trucks like other reviews said. The parking lot is small, but only one time did we have to ask the front desk to open the gate so we could park in the basement lot. This isn't a luxury hotel but good value in Beverely Hills. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western”
Reviews.Author: ocdrummerguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprisingly great stay for our quick trip to LA. Though the pictures of the rooms are slightly misleading, the beds and pillows were exceptional. Robertson can be a somewhat busy street, but our room was on the second floor above the street so you kind of expect that. Oh, and the "continental breakfast" was hardly continental.....I mean that in a good way. FRESH fruit, good coffee, and a fabulous selection of healthy items to start your day. These guys know how to do it. I would definitely go back to this hotel. It is close to Pico, which is a fairly main street, and all the shopping on Robertson is just down the street. Highly reccommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: autumnbottom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlyle Inn for two nights on a business trip. Convinient location, great breakfasts, FREE WiFi, lovely courtyard. I'd say this is a great hotel for business travelers. It's true, it can be a bit noisy in the rooms right on Robertson but it wasn't a prblem for a heavy sleeper like me. I'd say bring along a pair of ear plugs if you're a light sleeper. I stayed in room 201 which seemed plenty big enough for me and would have been perfectly acceptable for two. The room did smell a little bit funky (maybe very old cigarette smoke and carpet cleaner?) but i opened the window for an hour or two and i didn't even notice it. Tiny parking garage can be problematic and street parking is only for 30 minute time slots up until 6 pm, after which it's fair game.

Reviews.Title: “Charming value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I adored this hotel. The website pictures exactly portray what you get. My room was large, and felt comfortable and safe. The neighborhood is perfectly fine. Parking was a breeze. I loved the terrace, and took full advantage of it. The staff were all great. If you're expecting 5 star service, this is not for you. If you're looking for a fabulous bargain in a convenient area, this is the place. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms; misleading photos on Best Western Website”
Reviews.Author: theWimp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thanksgiving eve night, based on the rate from the Best Western web site. I opted for the "suite" with the sofa pullout. Hah ! Fooled again ! It was actually smaller than most standard hotel rooms. Also, the water heater was out that night and the front desk played dumb. Don't you love it when they do that ? Thankfully, it was repaired the next morning. Having said that, the exterior was extremely cool and the breakfast was outstanding. There is no lobby to speak of and the parking is minimal. Don't know what they do when the 15 or so spaces are filled. The bathrooms were spacious and clean enough for me. The rooms surround the open courtyard which looks nice but any conversation going on can be heard by all and you definitely do not want a room on Robertson Blvd, which is a high traffic road. This property is on the "fringe" of Beverly Hills, which accounts for the lower pricing. A better option, for about the same money as I wound up paying for my "suite", is the AAA rate at the Crown Plaza on Beverly Blvd. But this is an acceptable property, and I would stay here again. Just don't pay extra for the "suite".

Reviews.Title: “Good, but Bad. Used Credit Card Without permission”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: FirstOf All Let Me Say The StaffF Were Nice. The Rooms Are Small And The Breakfast was good.. I booked with my credit card and when i checked out i paid in cash ofr the four nights, I received my receipt as paid in full. when i returned home i received a voice mail form the general Manager that I still Owe $100.oo as i had not paid enought for the room. I called and spoke with a gentleman and he stated they woud not be charged on my credit card. BUT MY CREDIT CARD WAS CHARGED $100.00 ANYWAY. I had to call my credit card company and luckily i am able to prove thatIpaid cash for the four nights. the general manager seemed a bit scatterbrained as we had to tell her twice to raise the parking garage gate. this happen on two days that we had to go back in and tell her to open the gate. If it were not for charging me extra and using my credit card i woud have given the hotel four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: scarlett_reinhardt
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at that hotel because it had many good reviews in guides like The Frommer's. But when we arrived, I couldn't believe we would have to stay there. The neighbourghood is seedy, but the good thing is that it's near to the highway (well obviously if you have a car). The dining room looks dirty and the breakfast is very cheap altough included. Our room had a view on a filthy backstreet and every morning be were waken up by the sound of garbage picking. Parking lot is too small. The hotel's internet site is not to be trust, the pictures look much better than the reality. The lobby is very small and and literaly in the parkin lot. We arrived later (11PM) and there was no bell boy so we had to carry our luggages by ourselves.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Carlyle Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1119 South Robertson Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90035-1403
